title: French Adjective Agreement
description: Guide to French adjective gender and number agreement

content.content:
# French Adjective Agreement

French adjectives must agree with the nouns they modify in both gender and number. Unlike Spanish, French adjectives typically come after the noun they modify.

## Gender Agreement

Most French adjectives have two forms:

| Masculine | Feminine | Example (petit/e) |
|-----------|----------|-------------------|
| -e        | -e       | petit/petite      |
| -x        | -se      | heureux/heureuse  |
| -f        | -ve      | neuf/neuve        |
| -er       | -ère     | cher/chère        |

Key points:
- Add -e to masculine adjectives to make them feminine
- Some adjectives have irregular feminine forms
- Adjectives ending in -e are the same in masculine and feminine

## Number Agreement

To make adjectives plural:

| Singular Ending | Plural Ending | Example (petit/e) |
|----------------|---------------|-------------------|
| -e             | -es           | petits/petites    |
| -x             | -x            | heureux/heureuses |
| -al            | -aux          | national/nationaux |
| -eau           | -eaux         | beau/beaux        |

Key points:
- Add -s to make adjectives plural
- Some adjectives have irregular plural forms
- Adjectives ending in -x or -s don't change in the masculine plural
